materials.raw_text: B: 18 g, K: 3 g, Rb: 1 g, Se: 18 g, Sn: 2 g

sourcing.instructions: B (Boron powder) - Chemical supply store; K (Potassium metal) - Chemical supply store; Rb (Rubidium) - Specialty metal supplier; Se (Selenium powder) - Chemical supply store; Sn (Tin) - Metal supply store or online metal retailer.
steps: B (Boron powder) - Chemical supply store; K (Potassium metal) - Chemical supply store; Rb (Rubidium) - Specialty metal supplier; Se (Selenium powder) - Chemical supply store; Sn (Tin) - Metal supply store or online metal retailer.

1. Measure out 18 g of Boron powder, 3 g of Potassium metal, 1 g of Rubidium, 18 g of Selenium powder, and 2 g of Tin. 2. In a fume hood or well-ventilated area, combine the Boron, Selenium, and Tin in a ceramic or glass container. 3. Carefully add Potassium and Rubidium, ensuring minimal exposure to air and moisture. 4. Mix the powders thoroughly using a clean, dry spatula until a uniform mixture is achieved.
preparation.raw_text: 1. Measure out 18 g of Boron powder, 3 g of Potassium metal, 1 g of Rubidium, 18 g of Selenium powder, and 2 g of Tin. 2. In a fume hood or well-ventilated area, combine the Boron, Selenium, and Tin in a ceramic or glass container. 3. Carefully add Potassium and Rubidium, ensuring minimal exposure to air and moisture. 4. Mix the powders thoroughly using a clean, dry spatula until a uniform mixture is achieved.

steps: 1. Transfer the mixed powders to a high-temperature resistant crucible. 2. Heat in a muffle furnace to 800 째C. 3. Maintain this temperature for 2 hours to ensure complete reaction and formation of the compound.
heating.raw_text: 1. Transfer the mixed powders to a high-temperature resistant crucible. 2. Heat in a muffle furnace to 800 째C. 3. Maintain this temperature for 2 hours to ensure complete reaction and formation of the compound.

steps: 1. Turn off the furnace and allow it to cool down naturally to room temperature. 2. Once cooled, remove the crucible carefully using heat-resistant gloves.
cooling.raw_text: 1. Turn off the furnace and allow it to cool down naturally to room temperature. 2. Once cooled, remove the crucible carefully using heat-resistant gloves.

steps: 1. Grind the solid sample to ensure uniformity if necessary. 2. Optionally, sinter the sample at 600 째C for 1 hour to enhance structural integrity. 3. Allow to cool to room temperature again. 4. Optionally apply a sealant to the surface for protection against oxidation.
post_processing.raw_text: 1. Grind the solid sample to ensure uniformity if necessary. 2. Optionally, sinter the sample at 600 째C for 1 hour to enhance structural integrity. 3. Allow to cool to room temperature again. 4. Optionally apply a sealant to the surface for protection against oxidation.
